transcripts.text: Let's talk about feminism.  Hello, I'm Nicole Michelle, founder and femininity influencer for the Inner Beauty Movement.  Welcome back to all of you joining me again, and welcome if you're joining me for the very first time.  I appreciate it.  Please like, subscribe, and share.  Let's get right into it.  So there are some myths out there about feminism that I wanted to talk about.  Now, I do believe that the original creators of the feminist movement in the 1800s had good intentions.  They were not anti-family.  They weren't anti-men.  They did not believe in female supremacy.  They did want women to have the right to vote.  They didn't want women to be abused.  They didn't want women in situations where they couldn't inherit property, where they were second class citizens.  And so those are ideas that we can all get behind and support.  However, modern feminism has turned into an extreme version of feminism to where it is borderline female supremacy, whereas anti-male, anti-family feminism, I'm not here to fly the banner of feminism and I'm not here to support it.  But what I am here to do is clear up some things, some myths that a lot of women believe from the feminist movement because a lot of extreme ideas have been flushed into the mainstream and a lot of women are digesting this stuff and so confused and so frustrated.  They did not realize that they had subscribed to a lot of these myths and.
